Key Arguments: The legislation represents a form of censorship and an overreach by the government.
It infringes on the freedom of speech and suppresses debate.
Censorship is not the solution to controversies in a democratic society; debate is.
The legislation could lead to dictatorship and communistic censorship.
Existing laws already protect against hate speech and threats.
ACMA is unelected and should not have the power to determine misinformation.
Notable Quotes: This tyrannical overreach by the commonwealth government to dictate what can and cannot be voiced on social media platforms is removing the freedom to Free Speech.
This legislation will destroy democracy and open the door to dictatorship and communistic censorship.
ACMA is an unelected organisation that does not answer to the people of Australia and should not have the power to discern what is misinformation and disinformation.
